field.name: siteOfflineEnabled
field.label: Take site offline
field.description: When enabled visitors to the site will be redirected or shown the HTML below. You can specify IP addresses that will be allowed normal access to the site.

field.name: allowedIpAddresses
field.label: Allowed IPs
field.description:
When the site is offline you can restore normal access to specified IP addresses. Enter each IP address on a new line, eg:
12.122.243.12
216.79.56.167

field.name: offlineRedirectUrl
field.label: Redirect URL
field.description: When the site is offline you can redirect visitors to any URL. Enter the full URL here, eg. http://mysite.com/offline.html

field.name: offlineHTML
field.label: HTML
field.description: If you take the site offline you can add your own HTML here that will be displayed instead of the normal website.

field.name: enableAdminLink
field.label: Enable admin link
field.description: When enabled the admin icon/link in the top left of the standard administrator template will never be disabled.

field.name: generatorTagEnabled
field.label: Enable generator tag change
field.description: When enabled this will allow you to edit or remove the generator metatag.

field.name: metaGenerator
field.label: Generator tag
field.description: A standard Joomla! install adds a Generator metatag to the site head. Here you can clear it or change it to something more meaningful to you. Leave the field empty to remove the tag entirely.

field.name: s13
field.label: Open Graph / Twitter meta settings:
field.description: Configure your meta tags here for page sharing

field.name: ogTagEnabled
field.label: Enable openGraph tags change
field.description: When enabled this will allow you to create OpenGraph tags on all pages of the site.

field.name: twitterCard
field.label: twitter:card
field.description: Select card type

field.name: twitterTitle
field.label: twitter:title
field.description: Choose Auto to create based on page settings

field.name: twitterDescription
field.label: twitter:description
field.description: Choose Auto to create based on page settings, eg. if the page is an article it will use the article description (if present)

field.name: twitterSite
field.label: twitter:site
field.description: @username for the website used in the card footer.

field.name: twitterCreator
field.label: twitter:creator
field.description: @username for the content creator / author.

field.name: twitterImage
field.label: twitter:image
field.description: URL of image to use in the card. Images must be less than 5MB in size. JPG, PNG, WEBP and GIF formats are supported. Only the first frame of an animated GIF will be used. SVG is not supported.

field.name: twitterImageAlt
field.label: twitter:image:alt
field.description: A text description of the image conveying the essential nature of an image to users who are visually impaired. Maximum 420 characters.

field.name: ogTitle
field.label: og:title
field.description: Choose Auto to create based on page settings

field.name: ogUrl
field.label: og:url
field.description: The URL of the content. Choose Auto to create based on page settings

field.name: ogType
field.label: og:type
field.description: The type of your object, e.g., video.movie. Depending on the type you specify, other properties may also be required.

field.name: ogDescription
field.label: og:description
field.description: A brief description of the content. Choose Auto to create based on page settings, eg. if the page is an article it will use the article description (if present)

field.name: ogImage
field.label: og:image
field.description: The URL of an image for the social snippet. The plugin will get width and height values and add those attributes automatically.

field.name: ogImageAlt
field.label: og:image:alt
field.description: A description of what is in the image (not a caption). If the page specifies an og:image it should specify og:image:alt

field.name: ogLocale
field.label: og:locale
field.description: Defines the content language. Use only for content not written in American English (en_US). Facebook assumes content without this tag is written in this language.

field.name: replaceAnywhereEnabled
field.label: Enable replaceAnywhere
field.description:
When enabled this will allow use of variables in braces within the site content in articles, modules, plugins etc.
Some variables are set up already:
- {swiss.name}
- {swiss.username}
- {swiss.email}
- {swiss.lastvisitdate}
- {swiss.today.dd/mm/yyyy}
- {swiss.today.day}
- {swiss.today.date}
- {swiss.today.month}
- {swiss.today.year}

field.name: replaceCustom
field.label: Custom replacement strings
field.description:
If you have enabled replaceAnywhere you can add your own sitewide search/replace strings here. Each pair must be on its own line separated by =>, the format is:
search1=>replace1
search2=>replace2
search3=>replace3

2 things to note:
1) You can enter HTML here
2) This will also replace content in the HEAD section - so be careful!

field.name: insertCodeEnabled
field.label: Enable insertion of additional code
field.description: When enabled this will allow you to add CSS, javascript or HTML to the final page.

field.name: headStart
field.label: After opening HEAD tag
field.description: If you have enabled code insertion you can add code here that will be added to the rendered page straight after the HEAD tag

field.name: headEnd
field.label: Before closing HEAD tag
field.description: If you have enabled code insertion you can add code here that will be added to the rendered page before the closing HEAD tag. NB: other processes may run after this so there is a chance it could have items after it!

field.name: bodyStart
field.label: After opening BODY tag
field.description: If you have enabled code insertion you can add code here that will be added to the rendered page straight after the BODY tag

field.name: bodyEnd
field.label: Before closing BODY tag
field.description: If you have enabled code insertion you can add code here that will be added to the rendered page before the closing BODY tag

field.name: css
field.label: Enter some CSS
field.description: If you have enabled code insertion you can add CSS here that will be added to the head section of the rendered page. Do not put <style> tags in, just add the actual CSS!

field.name: cssExternal
field.label: External CSS sources
field.description: If you have enabled code insertion you can add external CSS sources here that will be added to the head section of the the rendered page. Theses should be in the format of URLs with one entry per line (ignore word-wrapping)

field.name: javascript
field.label: Enter Javascript code
field.description: If you have enabled code insertion you can add Javascript here that will be added to the head section of the the rendered page. Do not put <script> tags in, just add the actual JS code!

field.name: javascriptExternal
field.label: External JS sources
field.description: If you have enabled code insertion you can add external Javascript sources here that will be added to the head section of the the rendered page. Theses should be in the format of URLs with one entry per line (ignore word-wrapping)

field.name: oneClickLogoutEnabled
field.label: Enable 1 click logout
field.description:
When enabled logged in users can click the logout button without needing to confirm their action. This also means that you can create one click logout links, eg.
index.php?option=com_users&task=user.logout.

field.name: afterLoginSystemMessageEnabled
field.label: System message after login
field.description: When enabled the user will see the message below after logging in. Choose whether your message is marked as a message, a warning or an error (different styles will be applied by the template).

field.name: afterLoginSystemMessage
field.label: Login message
field.description: A message to display to users to after a successful login (System message after login must be enabled!)

field.name: afterLoginRedirectEnabled
field.label: Enable login redirect
field.description: When enabled you can redirect users after logging in by modifying the settings below.

field.name: afterLoginRedirectUsergroup
field.label: Group/s to redirect on login
field.description: Select which usergroup/s to redirect on login.

field.name: afterLoginRedirectUrl
field.label: Login redirect page
field.description: A page to redirect users from the selected group/s to after a successful login.

field.name: afterLogOutRedirectEnabled
field.label: Enable logout redirect
field.description:
When enabled you can redirect users after logging out by modifying the settings below.
NB: A side effect of this is that it also enables the one click logout, so you can create links like:
index.php?option=com_users&task=user.logout.

field.name: afterLogOutRedirectUsergroup
field.label: Group/s to redirect on logout
field.description: Select which usergroup/s to redirect on log out.

field.name: afterLogOutRedirectUrl
field.label: Logout redirect page
field.description: A page to redirect users to after logout.

field.name: failedLoginRedirectEnabled
field.label: Enable failed login handling
field.description: When enabled you can create a custom system message for failed login attempts and optionally force a delay before a retry is permitted.

field.name: failedLoginSystemMessage
field.label: Failed login message
field.description: A message to display to users to after a failed login attempt (leave empty to disable)

field.name: failedLoginSystemMessageType
field.label: Message type
field.description: Choose whether your message is marked as a message, a warning or an error (different styles will be applied by the template).

field.name: failedLoginRedirectUrl
field.label: Failed login redirect page
field.description: A page to redirect users to after a failed login.

field.name: failedLoginDelay
field.label: Retry delay
field.description: Enter just a number which will be the number of seconds that the system will delay subsequent login attempts by (set it to zero to disable)

field.name: registeredUserHomepageEnabled
field.label: Enable registered homepage
field.description: When enabled this will allow you to set a different home page for your registered users to that set in the menu structure. The result will be that when they click any HOME link they will be taken to the page you assign here.

field.name: registeredUserHomeGroup1
field.label: Group/s
field.description: Select the usergroup/s whose home page you will set below.

field.name: registeredUserHomeUrl1
field.label: New homepage
field.description: The menu item you select will become the home page for any registered users selected in the group above.

field.name: registeredUserHomeGroup2
field.label: Group/s
field.description: Select the usergroup/s whose home page you will set below.

field.name: registeredUserHomeUrl2
field.label: New homepage
field.description: The menu item you select will become the home page for any registered users selected in the group above.

field.name: registeredUserHomeGroup3
field.label: Group/s
field.description: Select the usergroup/s whose home page you will set below.

field.name: registeredUserHomeUrl3
field.label: New homepage
field.description: The menu item you select will become the home page for any registered users selected in the group above.

field.name: cookieDirectiveEnabled
field.label: Enable cookie alert
field.description: When enabled this will display info relating to the EU Cookie Directive, namely alerting users of the site that you use cookies. Once they accept the message will be gone from the screen.

field.name: cookieInfoText
field.label: Alert message
field.description: The text that users who have not accepted cookies will see. You can use HTML here so you wil be able to add links to your privacy policy, cookie info etc.
field.default: We use cookies to improve our website and your experience when using it. Cookies used for the essential operation of the site have already been set.

field.name: cookieButtonText
field.label: Accept button text
field.description: The text that will be on the acceptance button

field.name: cookieButtonClass
field.label: Button class
field.description: Add a class to the BUTTON tag (some templates have special styles for buttons).

field.name: cookieBoxPosition
field.label: Box position
field.description: Select position for the message box

field.name: cookieBodyMargin
field.label: Body margin
field.description: Enter an amount of margin to add to the BODY tag. This will become MARGIN-TOP if you chose to place the alert at the top of the page or MARGIN-BOTTOM if you chose to position the alert at the bottom of the page. This will help prevent the alert from obscuring content. Remember to include the units

field.name: cookieBoxColour
field.label: Box background
field.description: Select a colour for the background of the message box

field.name: cookieBoxWidth
field.label: Box width
field.description: Select a width for the message box and remember to include the units

field.name: cookieBoxPadding
field.label: Box padding
field.description: Select a size for the padding and remember to include the units

field.name: cookieBoxRadius
field.label: Box radius
field.description: Select a size for the border radius and remember to include the units

field.name: cookieTextColour
field.label: Text colour
field.description: Select a colour for the text of the message box

field.name: cookieTextSize
field.label: Text size
field.description: Select a size for the text and remember to include the units

field.name: cookieTextAlign
field.label: Text alignment
field.description: Select alignment for the text

field.name: s11
field.label: You should not use these unless you are prepared to do some coding! These are experimental works in progress (WIP)!

field.name: autoLoginEnabled
field.label: [WIP] Enable registration autologin
field.description:
NB: THIS IS EXPERIMENTAL!
When enabled this will automatically log newly registered user in. Note that it will only work if the registration setting is NONE in UserManager->Options->NewUserAccountActivation=NONE - otherwise the account is blocked and it will create a login failure.

field.name: debugOutputEnabled
field.label: [WIP] Enable debug output
field.description:
NB: THIS IS EXPERIMENTAL!
When enabled this will allow you show core Joomla! debug output, optionally restricted by IP address and/or user group.

field.name: debugUsergroup
field.label: Limit by usergroup
field.description: Limit debug output to specified user group/s.

field.name: debugIpAddress
field.label: Limit by IP
field.description: Limit debug output to specified IP address.

field.name: profile
field.label: Show Profiling
field.description: Display the profiling waypoints

field.name: queries
field.label: Show queries
field.description: Display a list the queries executed while displaying the page.

field.name: query_types
field.label: Show Query Types
field.description: Display a list of unique query types and their number of occurrences for the current page. Useful for finding out about repeated queries that are either redundant or which can be grouped into a single, more efficient query.

field.name: memory
field.label: Show Memory Usage
field.description: Display the total memory usage.

field.name: enableKeepAliveAllPages
field.label: Enable session keep alive
field.description:
When enabled you can specify which user groups will be able to stay logged in even after long periods of page inactivity. The plugin will add a small javascript snippet that will invisibly open a page via AJAX before the user is logged out in order to maintain the session.
NB: Joomla automatically addes a keepAlive script to any pages that have a login module, so even with this feature disabled in the plugin you may find some of your pages display keepAlive behaviour!

field.name: keepaliveUsergroup
field.label: Group/s to keep alive
field.description: Select which usergroup/s to apply the keep alive session to.

field.name: enableSessionEndAlert
field.label: Session end warning
field.description:
When enabled you can specify which user groups will be alerted before their session times out. Users within the selected usergroup will be alerted before session end and offered choices allowing them to choose to refresh the session or allow it to end.

Modal provides a modal window popup which is a bit prettier and has more configurable options (below).
Alert gives a Javascript alert which has the added bonus that on most systems it will pull user focus back to the window.

Both options offer users the choice to refresh the session or allow it to expire.

NB: Joomla automatically adds a keepAlive script to any pages that have a login module, and if you have enabled keepAlive in this plugin it would be pointless to alert the user if the session is ending (as it will not end!) so in those circumstances the alert will not be sent.

field.name: sessionEndTestMode
field.label: Activate test mode
field.description: When enabled you will receive the session end alert after 5 seconds and the logged out message 10 seconds later (though you will not be logged out until the session really ends). This could help you tweak styles etc. a bit faster than waiting for an actual session to timeout!

field.name: sessionEndStartTime
field.label: Alert time (seconds)
field.description: The amount of time (in seconds) before the session ends that you wish to alert users. Your total session time is set in your Joomla config, so if that is set to 15 and you enter 180 here the alert will pop up after 12 minutes of inactivity.

field.name: sessionEndAlertUsergroup
field.label: Group/s to warn
field.description: Select which usergroup/s to apply the session end alert to.

field.name: sessionEndAlertModalText
field.label: Modal alert message
field.default: Your user session has been inactive and you will be logged out automatically in {countdown}
field.description: A message that will appear in the modal box (if selected) before the session ends. Use a placeholder {countdown} to show a m:ss countdown timer. You can use HTML here.

field.name: sessionEndAlertModalSize
field.label: Modal warning size
field.description: The width and height of the modal alert box that tells users that their session will soon be ending.

field.name: sessionEndedModalText
field.label: Modal session end message
field.default: Your session has ended. You will have to log in again to continue.
field.description: A message that will appear in the modal box (if selected) after the session ends. You can use HTML here.

field.name: sessionEndedModalSize
field.label: Modal ended size
field.description: The width and height of the modal alert box that tells users that their session has ended.
